meanings.definition: Create a film or animation using the technique of rotoscoping.
meanings.sent1: The animator rotoscoped the character's movements to make them look more realistic.
meanings.sent2: She rotoscoped the dance sequence to add fluidity to the animation.
meanings.sent3: The filmmaker rotoscoped the cat's movements, turning it into a dancing sensation.
meanings.sent4: His artistic vision was rotoscoped onto the screen, bringing his ideas to life.
meanings.sent5: Rotoscoping the scene made the animation come alive with vibrant colors and smooth transitions.

meanings.definition: The process of tracing over live-action film footage to create realistic animation.
meanings.sent1: The rotoscoped frames added a lifelike quality to the animated movie.
meanings.sent2: Rotoscoped sequences seamlessly blended live-action with animation.
meanings.sent3: The comical effect of rotoscoped characters interacting with real actors was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared as she watched the rotoscoped world unfold before her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the rotoscoped scenes captured the essence of reality in a magical way.
